column4: Is there an award for most obscure question of the day/week ??  ;)
we can start one :)
Great idea but just to warn you, the rest of you don't have a chance ... I can dig em up from places you wouldn't even dream of  ... :-!
heh
firstly why are you compiling your own version of Gnome ?
try installing libldap2-dev
It doesn't show up for me in synaptic, where might it be hidden ?
you probably have to add the universe repository
I have and don't find it there ... :-(
did you do an update of the repositories ?
apt-get update or in Synaptic click the reload button
now there's a good question, not in the last couple of days but will now, back in a minute, thanks
Still digging and don't find open-ldap-dev   or anything for that matter that is ldap except something from sourceforge and I don't think its that one!?
are you running warty or hoary
warty
you don't have the universe repository enabled
thought I did, how can I make sure ..
easiest is to run synaptic then >> settings >>reposiroties
I think you got me, how do I add universe?
click the ubuntu repsoitory (that has main in the section)  add the sections to look like this >> main restricted universe
there you go
Kamion I'm thrilled for the help really but you guys go so fast yo loose where am I now .. I do have universe installed
GL :)
